Name.label: Other immunodeficiency syndrome with predominantly antibody defects

TextSection.Contents: Osteopetrosis-hypogammaglobulinemia syndrome is an extremely rare primary bone dysplasia with increased bone density disorder characterized by severe osteoclast-poor osteopetrosis associated with hypogammaglobulinemia. Patients typically present infantile malignant osteopetrosis (manifesting with increased bone density, bone fractures, abnormal eye movements/visual loss, nystagmus), hematologic abnormalities with bone marrow failure (e.g. anemia, hepatosplenomegaly) and immunological deficiency (manifesting as recurrent respiratory infections) associated with reduced immunoglobulin levels due to impaired peripheral B cell differentiation.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))

Synonym.label: Autosomal recessive osteoclast-poor osteopetrosis with hypogammaglobulinemia
